Services > uiError

uiError

Include uiError as a dependency in your app module 

var module = angular.module('myModule', ['uiError']);
Place ui-toast element into your HTML. 

...
<ui-toast></ui-toast>
...
Inject uiError provider in your controller 

module.controller($scope, uiError) {...};

Open an error toast.

Just click the toast to close it.
Open Error Toast 

<ui-button size="small" 
       ng-click="openToast('Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, sit at modo dissentiet definitiones. 
                            Quod lobortis salutatus has ut, melius aperiri signiferumque ad sed. Sit tale suas erant ad. 
                            Id rebum soleat doming vix')">
Open Error Toast
</ui-button>
In the controller 

$scope.openToast = function(text) {
    uiError.create({
        content: text,
        dismissOnTimeout: false,
        dismissButton: true
    });
};

Open an error toast with an content object.

Just click the toast to close it.
Open Error Toast 

<ui-button size="small" ng-click="openToastMultiple(errortitle, errorcontent)">
Open Error Toast
</ui-button>
In the controller 

$scope.openToast = function(title, content) {
    uiError.create({
        title: title,
        content: content,
        dismissOnTimeout: false,
        dismissButton: true
    });
};

Open an success toast.

Just click the toast to close it.
Open Success Toast 

<ui-button size="small" 
    ng-click="openToast('Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, sit at modo dissentiet definitiones. 
                         Quod lobortis salutatus has ut, melius aperiri signiferumque ad sed. Sit tale suas erant ad. 
                         Id rebum soleat doming vix')">
    Open Success Toast
</ui-button>
In the controller 

$scope.openToast = function(text) {
    uiError.create({
        content: text,
        dismissOnTimeout: false,
        dismissButton: true,
        className: 'success'
    });
};

Open an error toast, which will close itself after a timeout

Open Error Toast with auto close timeout 

<ui-button size="small" 
    ng-click="openToastAutoClose('Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, sit at modo dissentiet definitiones. 
                                  Quod lobortis salutatus has ut, melius aperiri signiferumque ad sed. 
                                  Sit tale suas erant ad. Id rebum soleat doming vix', 10000)">
    Open Error Toast with auto close timeout
</ui-button>
In the controller 

$scope.openToastAutoClose = function(text, timeout) {
    uiError.create({
        content: text,
        dismissOnTimeout: true,
        timeout: timeout,
        dismissButton: false
    });
};

Close all error toast

Close Error Toast 

<ui-button size="small" ng-click="closeToast()">Close Error Toast</ui-button>
In the controller 

$scope.closeToast = function() {
    uiError.dismiss();
};

Options

Property Type Default description
title string if the title is there it will be displayed with an content of object type.
content object/string if the content is a single string the message is displayed as a single line. if the content is an object then it's displayed as a ordered list. the object format should be as follow: 

{
    name: {
        name: '',
        value: '',
        message: 'Study name should be between 1 and 45 characters'
    },
    description: {
        name: '',
        value: '',
        message: 'This is a scrollable area'
    },
    ...
}
Content of the toast message as string (HTML is supported).
dismissButton boolean true Display the close button.
dismissOnTimeout boolean true Allows error messages to be removed automatically after a specified time.
timeout number 10000 Wait time for removal of created error message
